25_06_12.gpx.name: One way to spend a day in San Fran

25_06_14.gpx.name: On the road: Eureka -> Sue Meg State Park

25_06_16.gpx.name: Prairie Creek Redwoods -> Jedadiah Smith Redwoods
25_06_16.gpx.desc: And a rendezvous with Alana on the home stretch of her around the world tour

25_06_21.gpx.name: Sunset Bay -> Coos Bay
25_06_21.gpx.desc: Early rise, then three buses to Sisters to jump onto the Oregon Timber Trail.Plus some overnight raccoon damage minimisation.

25_06_23.gpx.name: Sisters -> Camp Sherman
25_06_23.gpx.desc: Starting on the Oregon Timber Trail (gravel edition)

25_06_24.gpx.name: Camp Sherman -> Tule Lake
25_06_24.gpx.desc: Views of Mt Washington, then our first glimpses of Mt Jefferson

25_06_28.gpx.name: Breitenbush river valley -> Olallie Lake
25_06_28.gpx.desc: Climbing, foraging, OTT testing the definition of gravel here. Big fire in 2020. Bonus pic from a later flight outta Oregon.

25_06_29.gpx.name: Olallie Lake -> Timothy Lake
25_06_29.gpx.desc: Treated to some single track, and an especially lovely campground. First glimpses of Mt Hood, which weâ€™d semi-circumnavigate the next two days.

25_06_30.gpx.name: Timothy Lake -> Windy Campground, Surveyors Ridge

25_07_01.gpx.name: Windy Campground -> Parkdale
25_07_01.gpx.desc: Great views and a bangin decent down from Surveyors Ridge. And a very welcome pub feed after two days on rationsâ€¦

25_07_02.gpx.name: Parkdale -> Hood River
25_07_02.gpx.desc: A surprising lovely pedal down to Hood River, short-cutting the end of the Oregon Timber Trail to catch a bus down the Columbia River gorge to Portland

25_07_26.gpx.name: Westfjords Day 1: StaÃ°arskÃ¡li -> Laugar Campsite
25_07_26.gpx.desc: With a Laugar hot spring bathe like the many before us since ~1000AD

25_07_29.gpx.name: Westfjords Day 4: Ã¾orskafjÃ¶rÃ°ur -> KjÃ¡lkafjÃ¶rdur
25_07_29.gpx.desc: Some Walter Mitty energy for sure

25_07_30 1.gpx.name: Westfjords Day 5: KjÃ¡lkafjÃ¶rÃ°ur -> StykkishÃ³lmur, ferry assisted

25_07_31.gpx.name: Westfjords Day 6: StykkishÃ³lmur -> near Borgarnes
25_07_31.gpx.desc: With an unintended mountain pass rather than admit we took a wrong turn. Plus: hot pot, and another lovely gravel pit

25_08_01.gpx.name: Westfjords Day 7: Short pedal into Borgarnes for a bus back to ReykjavÃ­k

25_10_29.gpx.name: 29/10/2025 Putney -> Surry Hills
25_10_29.gpx.desc: Bit of a late start out of London but good to make some ground towards Portsmouth - we got a ferry to catch! Richmond Park was a lovely route out of the city. As usual getting on the bike makes all the fuss worthwhile :)

25_10_30.gpx.name: 30/10/2025 Surry Hills -> Portsmouth
25_10_30.gpx.desc: A frosty morning, but a lovely start through some leafy trails. Then much of the day on quiet winding backroads through the South Downs National Park, until the industrial reaches of Portsmouth (good cycling infrastructure beside much of the freeway though). Arrived with plenty of time to spare. Free pastries from the Yew Tree cafe in Goldaming was a treat.

25_11_01.gpx.name: 01/11/2025 El Puerto de Bilbao -> up the hill from Elaxalde
25_11_01.gpx.desc: Rolled off the ferry and into Santurzti for a long coffee break to get reacquainted with solid ground ðŸ¤¢ Then meandered upriver enjoying Bilbaoâ€™s vibe. The climb straight out of (Plaza Nueva?) came as a shock with our route sending us up some 20% alleys on el Camindo de Santiago (northern route). Then the wet set in, and when the dark did too we pulled up short for the night beside a council water pumping station in some hills (hoping this wonâ€™t offend anyone (Basques). Following Vuelta de Vasco for a few days: https://bikepacking.com/routes/basque-bikepacking-vuelta-de-vasco/

25_11_02.gpx.name: 02/11/2025 Elaxalde -> Mutriku
25_11_02.gpx.desc: After a bit of slipping and sliding in the mud, bailing on to the very pleasant roads with all the other cyclists was a great idea. As was coffee and pintxos at the first cafe en route in Guernica. A very pleasant day of road riding followed, through ever-more picturesque coastal Basque towns.

25_11_04.gpx.name: 04/11/2025 Mutriku -> Donastia / San SebastiÃ¡n
25_11_04.gpx.desc: A mere 4km before coffee and treats - getting used to this. More coastal roads, more pretty coastal towns, some silly hike-a-bike in the route that weâ€™re going to try to forget. The high ridge of Mt Igeldo after dark was atmospheric before dropping into Donastia / San SebastiÃ¡n.

25_11_05.gpx.name: 06/11/2025 Donastia -> Leitzaran valley
25_11_05.gpx.desc: Just an arvo session rolling out of Donastia / San SebastiÃ¡n, then onto a lovely vias verdes, i.e. rail trail, for a pleasant, gentle climb along the Leitzaran river. A disused train tunnel made for a welcome camp out of the rain.

25_11_14.gpx.name: 14/11/2025 LogroÃ±o -> Ribafrecha
25_11_14.gpx.desc: Good to get a few kms done after a day dominated again by some productive admin. It was pleasant to ride through dusk.

25_11_15.gpx.name: 15/11/2025 Ribafrecha -> Refugio Monte Real
25_11_15.gpx.desc: Pretty nice for a day of basically nonstop climbing! The podcasts help. Up the Leza river CaÃ±on and then onto the Sierra del a Cebollera. Some pleasant gravel and weather up until the last 5km when both turned, but hard to stay feeling sorry for yourself in a hut. Made a good new addition to the camping recipe book: shepherds pie.

25_11_16.gpx.name: 16/11/2025 Refugio Monte Real -> near Cornago
25_11_16.gpx.desc: A good feeling to wake up to a view you couldnâ€™t see the night before. A cold morning up high but a nice decent down from the pre-alpine scrub into forest, then further down into scrub again, with a Mediterranean feel. After coffee, tapas, and a look at the dinosaurio footprints in Enciso, didnâ€™t make it far up the road before suddenly it was dark - not sure where the time went (well, to the sleep in and tapas I think).

25_11_17.gpx.name: 17/11/2025 Cornago -> Monte Alcarama
25_11_17.gpx.desc: A new routine: camp just below the top of a hill, with a short climb to get warm before the fun starts. The descent into Cornago was a fast one, but I think my computer exaggerated a little with the 109kphâ€¦ Cornago was a cool but confusing little town! Is this 2025 or 1625? After another accidentally long coffee stop, it was a slow and steady climb on nice gravel well into the Sierra de Alcarama. Up to a pleasant camp in the pine plantation, nicely terraced just for our tenting needs. Lulled to sleep by the sound of the wind turbines...

25_11_26.gpx.name: 26/11/2025 Zaragoza -> Samper de Calanda
25_11_26.gpx.desc: So glad the prevailing wind wants to go exactly where we do - to the Mediterranean. After a nice week WOOFing at Tropicana Escribana, it was cruisy out of Zaragoza, through the industrial area and into the crop lands. We just had to point ourselves in the right direction. A few glimpses of the Ebro river along the way, which was taking a much windier route than us.

25_11_27.gpx.name: 27/11/2025 Samper de Calanda -> Cretas
25_11_27.gpx.desc: Rail trails for days - except where theyâ€™re closed with very little info. More small towns with outsized churches, and some old olive trees. Some pretty landscapes today, can feel the Mediterranean getting closerâ€¦

25_11_28.gpx.name: 28/11/2025 Cretas -> Amposta, then Barca by train
25_11_28.gpx.desc: Now thatâ€™s a rail trailâ€¦ the Val de ZafÃ¡n vias verde producing one of my better days of cycling, winding through the PÃ ndols and Cavalls ranges. Weâ€™re calling Amposta as close enough to the Mediterranean by pedal power, now itâ€™s a train to Barcelona.

25_12_01.gpx.name: 01/12/2025 Ventimiglia -> Andora, train assisted
25_12_01.gpx.desc: After a marathon 6 trains and a bus, we made it to Liguria! And our final leg towards MilanThat first (and second and third) focaccia hit the spot. Very nice to cycle again, albeit briefly - after experiencing some of the med coast, one final train was a convenient way to get back on track to some booked accomm.

25_12_02.gpx.name: 02/12/2025 Andora -> Borghetto Santo Spirito
25_12_02.gpx.desc: Cruisy day along the coast, taking it easy. Got a cool view right along the Ligurian coast from Cape Mele, right along to about La Spezia we reckon - looking to the next few days ahead.

25_12_03.gpx.name: 03/12/2025 Borghetto Santo Spirit -> Savona
25_12_03.gpx.desc: A little wet, but at least no wind. Fresh pasta, good cheese, and wine makes for some gourmet camping meals.

25_12_04.gpx.name: 04/12/2025 Savona -> Genoa
25_12_04.gpx.desc: More cruise riding, and fun to check out Genoa. A rude hilly back track + detour because of 100m of rail trail works with no warning, but I swear Iâ€™m over it!! First pizza helped.

25_12_05.gpx.name: 05/12/2025 Tornato - the river Po
25_12_05.gpx.desc: After a train over the mountains from Genoa, suddenly itâ€™s winter
